inclusion.criterion: primary regurgitant jet originates from malcoaptation of the A2 and P2 scallops
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: trans-septal catheterization is determined to be feasible by the treating physician
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: predicted procedural mortality risk calculated using the STS surgical risk calculator of ≥12%
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: symptomatic moderate to severe (3+) or severe (4+) chronic MR and in the judgment of the investigator intervention to reduce MR is likely to provide symptomatic relief for the patient
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: evidence of an Acute Myocardial Infarction (AMI) in the prior 12 weeks of the intended treatment
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: leaflet flail is present and Flail Width ≥15 mm, or Flail Gap ≥10 mm.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has Marfan's syndrome with severe mitral valve prolapse and regurgitation. She remains symptomatic and is prepared to undergo mitral valve repair/replacement surgery.
